# Roleplay Rule 12 – Do Not Abandon Your Role
When you join a round in Prospect Sector, you are expected to **play the role you selected** and contribute to station progression or expeditions in a reasonable way.
Abandoning your role includes: - Ignoring essential responsibilities of your job - Leaving the round without attempting to cryo - Wandering off to do unrelated projects while your department is falling apart - Taking a role you never intended to play
This rule is enforced **more strictly for command and critical station roles**, and less strictly for flexible or low-impact roles.
If you must leave early: - Cryo if possible - Notify command or your department - If you must leave immediately, do so—real life always comes first. Patterns of early quitting may result in role bans, but isolated incidents will not.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - As an engineer, building small side projects when the station has stable power and no urgent tasks. - As command, taking part in harmless RP or learning another job when the station is stable. - As a passenger, working on personal builds with materials provided by other departments. - Taking short breaks from your job when you’re not needed urgently. - Doing the basic minimum for your job if you are inexperienced or overwhelmed. - Trying your best at your job but failing due to inexperience or mistakes.
### Prohibited: - As an engineer, doing personal projects while the station has no power or major issues. - As command, leaving the station unattended to join expeditions when leadership is needed. - As atmos, disappearing to build side projects while atmospherics is broken. - Ignoring your entire job all round while urgent work needs doing. - Leaving, ghosting, or suiciding at round start for personal preference (map, players, etc.). - Taking a job just to immediately quit it and do something unrelated. - Abandoning your role to chase ghost roles or other unrelated gameplay.
